Package org.jgroups.opentelemetry.spi

Interface InstrumentationContext

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicInstrumentationContext
public interface InstrumentationContext
Context passed to MetricsInstrumentation.registerMetrics(InstrumentationContext) containing all dependencies needed to register metrics for a protocol.

This context interface encapsulates:

  • The protocol instance to instrument
  • The OpenTelemetry meter for registering metrics
Author:
Radoslav Husar

  • Method Details

    • protocol

      org.jgroups.stack.Protocol protocol()
      Gets the protocol instance to instrument.
      Returns:
      The protocol instance

    • getPrefix

      default String getPrefix()
      Gets the metric name prefix for this protocol, including a trailing dot. The prefix follows the pattern "jgroups.{protocol_name}." where the protocol name is derived from the fully qualified class name with the JGroups protocol package prefix removed. For example:
      • org.jgroups.protocols.UNICAST3 → jgroups.unicast3.
      • org.jgroups.protocols.pbcast.GMS → jgroups.pbcast.gms.
      • org.jgroups.protocols.JDBC_PING → jgroups.jdbc_ping.
      Returns:
      The metric name prefix with trailing dot (e.g., "jgroups.unicast3.", "jgroups.pbcast.gms.")

    • meter

      io.opentelemetry.api.metrics.Meter meter()
      Gets the OpenTelemetry meter for registering metrics.
      Returns:
      The meter

    • getAttributes

      default io.opentelemetry.api.common.Attributes getAttributes()
      Gets the attributes to be attached to metrics for this protocol. The attributes include contextual information such as the cluster name and node identifier. These attributes allow distinguishing metrics from different nodes within the same cluster.
      Returns:
      The attributes containing cluster-level and node-level metadata

    • exposeConfigurationMetrics

      boolean exposeConfigurationMetrics()
      Indicates whether protocol configuration values should be exposed as metrics. Configuration metrics include values like thresholds, enabled flags, and other protocol settings that can change at runtime.
      Returns:
      true if configuration metrics should be exposed, false otherwise
